text: Gilbert Taylor (12 April 1914 - 23 August 2013) was a British cinematographer. He worked on several movies such as Dr. Strangelove, A Hard Day's Night, The Omen and Star Wars. Taylor was born on 12 April 1914 in Bushey Heath, Hertfordshire, England. After six years service in World War II as an officer in the Royal Air Force Volunteer Reserve, he became an operational cameraman flying in Avro Lancaster bombers, documenting the damage after British bombing raids. Taylor died on 23 August 2013 in Newport, Isle of Wight from natural causes, aged 99. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Profile and interview by the American Society of Cinematographers, on the occasion of his International Achievement Award Category:1914 births Category:2013 deaths Category:British cinematographers Category:People from Hertfordshire
title: Gilbert Taylor
